channel.title: EasyRSC Server Help
channel.description:
I need help setting up my server.
In my distributed client settings I have this:
server=127.0.0.1 port=43594 config_dir=conf/client media_dir=media movie_fps=5
I know this is the Default server IP. How do I get a server IP? Can I Use Hamachi VPN for this? If so, how?

item.title: EasyRSC Server Help
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

If it doesn’t help hes a tool nemmy

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Server Help
item.dc:creator: @Nemesis1 Nemesis-
item.description:
@Nemesis1 wrote:

Yes you can use Hamachi, It’s not recommended though, because most people don’t want to download hamachi to play.

http://www.no-ip.com to create a No-Ip DNS,
You can create addresses like:
*name.sytes.net
*name.no-ip.info
*name.no-ip.org

Download the DUC Client and login with your account.
Then you should have your own server address, Some routers it requires ‘Port Forwarding’, There’s lots of tutorials for different routers at:
http://www.portforward.com

but if you cannot find a solution to portforward, there’s easier way, but may not work in all modems/routers or PCs, it’s called UPnP, And a BitTorrent program called uTorrent uses this, so download it and make it use port 43594.
I heard it works, but i haven’t tried it myself.

If you want to check if your ports are open, use following website:
http://www.canyouseeme.org/

After all this, it should work just fine, I might have forgotten something, if so, correct me

Read full topic

item.title: EasyRSC Server Help
item.dc:creator: @CarsonClassic CarsonClassic
item.description:
@CarsonClassic wrote:

I need help setting up my server.

In my distributed client settings I have this:

server=127.0.0.1
port=43594
config_dir=conf/client
media_dir=media
movie_fps=5

I know this is the Default server IP. How do I get a server IP? Can I Use Hamachi VPN for this? If so, how?

Read full topic
